headline.main: Giving It the Old College Try

docs.abstract: In this lesson, students share opinions about how their lives might change when they enter college. They then role-play four scenarios that might occur in their freshman year and write a reflection paper that addresses how their rights may affect their behavior and relationships.

byline.original: By JENNIFER RITTNER and YASMIN CHIN EISENHAUER

docs.lead_paragraph: Note: This lesson was originally published on an older version of The Learning Network; the link to the related Times article will take you to a page on the old site.
docs.snippet: In this lesson, students share opinions about how their lives might change when they enter college. They then role-play four scenarios that might occur in their freshman year and write a reflection paper that addresses how their rights may affect...

headline.print_headline: So Big and Healthy Nowadays That Grandpa Wouldn’t Even Know You
headline.main: So Big and Healthy Grandpa Wouldn’t Even Know You

docs.lead_paragraph: The past 100 years has seen a change from small, sickly people to humans who are so robust their ancestors are almost unrecognizable.
docs.snippet: The past 100 years has seen a change from small, sickly people to humans who are so robust their ancestors are almost unrecognizable.

headline.print_headline: Learning to Get By On Aspirin, Coffee and Grit
headline.main: Dancers Learn to Get By on Aspirin, Coffee and Grit

docs.lead_paragraph: Dancers face the pain of performing without the illegal boosts that some athletes use.
docs.snippet: Dancers face the pain of performing without the illegal boosts that some athletes use.
